candidates.title: deps: use spl-token-2022-interface instead of spl-token-2022
candidates.body:
In addition removed useless `^` / `~`

I still not sure that it was correct to use next dependencies without `~` because we don't know yet would Anza respect semver for geyser now or not, but release already published so probably we need to stay with default `^` :confused: 
```
agave-geyser-plugin-interface = "3.0.0"
solana-account-decoder = "3.0.0"
solana-storage-proto = "3.0.0"
solana-transaction-context = "3.0.0"
solana-transaction-status = "3.0.0"
```

Everything bumped as patch.

candidates.title: str-113: bug fix transaction account keys
str-38: support Bytes for account data
plugin: put cancellation token
candidates.body:
Close #617 

# Bug

ot reloading the geyser plugin appears to leave behind "zombie" connections, suggesting that unloading the plugin isn’t properly closing active connections.

On closer inspection of the plugin’s on_unload method, we do call shutdown on the Tokio runtime created during Plugin::load. However, shutdown does not terminate tasks spawned with tokio::spawn, as documented [here](https://docs.rs/tokio/latest/tokio/runtime/struct.Runtime.html#shutdown).

> The [shutdown_background](https://docs.rs/tokio/latest/tokio/runtime/struct.Runtime.html#method.shutdown_background) and [shutdown_timeout](https://docs.rs/tokio/latest/tokio/runtime/struct.Runtime.html#method.shutdown_timeout) methods can be used if waiting forever is undesired. When the timeout is reached, spawned work that did not stop in time and threads running it are leaked.

Because we rely heavily on tokio::spawn for gRPC connections, this behavior likely explains why orphaned connections remain after the plugin is unloaded.

# After 

This PR introduce the usage of [CancellationToken](https://docs.rs/tokio-util/0.7.16/tokio_util/sync/struct.CancellationToken.html) and [TaskTracker](https://docs.rs/tokio-util/0.7.16/tokio_util/task/task_tracker/struct.TaskTracker.html).

All fire-and-forget tokio::spawn calls have been replaced with TaskTracker::spawn, combined with a tree-structured `CancellationToken`. This ensures that every task spawned by the plugin components listens to the same cancellation signal during Plugin::on_unload.

The `CancellationToken` centralizes shutdown logic, allowing us to signal all tasks at once when the plugin is being unloaded. Inside Plugin::on_unload, we then perform a graceful shutdown using `TaskTracker::wait`, ensuring that both auxiliary and gRPC tasks are properly terminated.

candidates.title: feat: agave 3.0 dependency upgrades, ci fixes, version bumps, changelog
fix(slot_messages): handle lower write_version by dropping messages
candidates.body:
This PR fixes an edge case in account update deduplication for `slot_messages.messages`.

### Background

Yellowstone gRPC saves account updates into `slot_messages.messages`.
The intent is to keep only the latest (highest `write_version`) account update per pubkey within a slot.
Deduplication is tracked via `slot_messages.accounts_dedup`.

### Problem

Previously, when an account update arrived out of order (with a `write_version` **lower** than the highest seen so far), the code failed to discard it.
Because messages are appended to `slot_messages.messages` **before** deduplication logic runs, this resulted in multiple updates being saved for the same pubkey in a slot.

### Fix

Added an else branch to handle the case where the new update’s `write_version` is lower than the latest one.
The new (out-of-order) message is immediately dropped by marking its array entry as `None`.
This ensures only the latest `write_version` per pubkey survives.

### Impact

Prevents saving multiple account updates per pubkey in a slot.
Preserves intended deduplication semantics.

candidates.title: Better load monitoring
candidates.body:
Added sevral metrics for geyser and load tracking client session.
Client load uses EMA (Exponential-Moving-Average) to smooth out metrics and remove noise and extreme short-live spike in prometheus/grafana.

candidates.title: tonic,solana-crates: update tonic to 0.14, unpinned solana crates
Remove deprecated solana-sdk dependency
candidates.body:
- removes deprecated `solana-sdk` dependency
- bumps version numbers
- updates changelog
- signed commits

This PR is continuation of PR https://github.com/rpcpool/yellowstone-grpc/pull/562. Thanks and credits to to @kevinheavey for the orignal PR

candidates.title: TS SDK version bump and Cargo.lock update
fix: Slot update message now handles levels missing from CommitmentLevel
candidates.body: In the Rust example, subscribing to slot updates sometimes misses updates with certain commitment levels.  This leads to errors and unnecessary reconnections, a process that repeats continuously. This issue should be fixed.

candidates.title: geyser: string to u64 dserializer
candidates.body:
The param `replay_stored_slots` is of type `u64`. This PR adds a string to u64 deserializer to it.

fixes #542

candidates.title: geyser: runtime error on invalid commitment
Expose TLS Config as part of the client
candidates.body:
I am getting:
```
Error: tonic::transport::Error(Transport, ConnectError(HttpsUriWithoutTlsSupport(())))
```
When using the latest gRPC client against an https endpoint. To fix this I need to specify a ClientTLSConfig, but I cannot because it's not exposed as part of the yellowstone-grpc-client.

Relevant issue:
https://github.com/hyperium/tonic/issues/1817

Note:
For some reason, I do not get this error when using the 1.15 client. Only 2.0.0 and above.

candidates.title: proto: move enum Message from geyser crate
examples: add progress bar to client tool
geyser: limit length of filter name
version: bump
candidates.body: Bump version for crates.io. We can not publish with solana change `~1.18`  -> `~2.0` without doing a major version bump in gRPC crates.

candidates.title: geyser: fix filter update loop on snapshot
fix: continue to snapshot subscribe once filter received
candidates.body:
## Issue
When filters are received the loop continue which prevents connection from moving to next loop to receive messages.

## Fix
Break after receive filters. Snapshot only supports applying the first filter set it receives.

chosen_pr.body:
In addition removed useless `^` / `~`

I still not sure that it was correct to use next dependencies without `~` because we don't know yet would Anza respect semver for geyser now or not, but release already published so probably we need to stay with default `^` :confused: 
```
agave-geyser-plugin-interface = "3.0.0"
solana-account-decoder = "3.0.0"
solana-storage-proto = "3.0.0"
solana-transaction-context = "3.0.0"

```

Everything bumped as patch.
